isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine Service, Model Year 1994 - 1998 - CRANKCASE, CRANKSHAFT, CONNECTING RODS AND PISTONS - Connecting Rods, Pistons and Piston Rings - Check Connecting Rod Bearing Bore for Out-of-Round and Taper

svcproc.title: Check Connecting Rod Bearing Bore for Out-of-Round and Taper

caution.para: When lubricated with clean engine oil, the rod nuts must thread onto the connecting rod studs by hand. If excessive resistance is felt, clean the connecting rod threads and try a new nut. If the new nut does not thread on freely, the connecting rod bolt must be replaced. Failure to do so may result in engine damage.

step1.para: Lubricate the connecting rod nuts with clean engine oil. Assemble the cap to the rod with the bearing insert removed. Tighten the nuts to the special torque value.

figure.caption: Measuring the Connecting Rod Bearing Bore for Out-of-Round

step1.para: Use an inside micrometer (telescoping gauge) to measure the connecting rod at three locations approximately 120° apart. Label them A, B and C.
If the difference between micrometer reading "B" and the average of reading "A" and reading "C" exceeds the out-of-round specification, the connecting rod must be replaced.
[(A+C)÷2] - B = actual reading (If the result is negative, disregard the negative sign.)

Check the connecting rod bearing bore taper by measuring the bore inner diameter near the large chamfer. Record the reading. Then measure the bore inner diameter near the small chamfer. Record the reading.
The difference between the two readings is the bore taper. If the connecting rod exceeds the specification, replace the connecting rod.
With the connecting rod cap removed, inspect the surface finish of the connecting rod bearing bore. The bore must be smooth and free of scoring, nicks and burrs. Replace as required.
